statuses.name:
The North, East and South (Dee, Clwyd, 
Ynys Mon, North Gwynedd, South Gwynedd, Upper Severn 
and Wye, Usk, Valleys and Vale of Glamorgan)
The West (North Ceredigion, Teifi, Pembrokeshire, Carmarthen and Swansea & Llanelli
Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
Scotland
statuses.detailed_status: Conditions range from normal water availability in the west, to water scarcity in the east.

statuses.name: Republic of Ireland
statuses.detailed_status:
Nearly a third of counties are in drought status, including Donegal, Dublin, Cork, Limerick, 
Galway, Meath, Tipperary, Waterford, Clare, Wexford, and Westmeath.

statuses.name: Kent and South London
statuses.detailed_status: The area of the region supplied by South East Water is in drought. The remainder of the region is in normal conditions.

statuses.name: Solent and South Downs
statuses.detailed_status: The area of the region supplied by South East Water is in drought. The remainder of the region is experiencing prolonged dry weather.
